        "id": "a74e19a3-1903-49c8-a65d-bd5c92d23712",
        "date": 1757116800,
        "cycle_day": 13,
        "cycle_length": 25,
        "phase": "Fertile-Window",
        "phase_day_in_phase": 7,
        "pregnancy_chance": "High (~35-40%) - Peak fertility time!",
        "logged_symptoms": [],
        "symptoms_insights": [
            {
                "name": "Calm",
                "symptom_text": "You may be feeling Calm",
                "fun_fact": "Feeling zen? Studies show that experiencing calm can actually boost your immune system!",
                "possible_causes": [
                    "A balanced diet rich in fruits and veggies",
                    "Prioritizing restful sleep (aim for 7-9 hours!)",
                    "Spending quality time with loved ones"
                ],
                "tips": [
                    "Embrace the feeling! Savor the moment and appreciate the peace.",
                    "Share the good vibes! A little kindness goes a long way.",
                    "Journal about what's contributing to your calm state. This can help you replicate it!"
                ]
            },
            {
                "name": "Relaxed",
                "symptom_text": "You may be feeling Relaxed",
                "fun_fact": "Feeling zen? Studies show relaxation can boost your immune system!",
                "possible_causes": [
                    "Engaging in enjoyable hobbies",
                    "Adequate sleep and rest",
                    "Lower stress levels (yay!)"
                ],
                "tips": [
                    "Embrace the calm! Enjoy a mindful moment.",
                    "Share the good vibes! Connect with loved ones.",
                    "Keep doing what you're doing! Maintain your self-care routine."
                ]
            },
            {
                "name": "Headache",
                "symptom_text": "You may experience a headache",
                "fun_fact": "Headaches have been around since the dawn of time! Ancient Egyptians even used willow bark (a natural form of aspirin) to treat them.",
                "possible_causes": [
                    "Stress: Tension headaches are super common when you're feeling overwhelmed.",
                    "Dehydration: Not enough water can lead to a throbbing head.",
                    "Skipped meals: Low blood sugar can trigger a headache."
                ],
                "tips": [
                    "Gentle stretching or a short walk can help relieve tension.",
                    "Hydrate, hydrate, hydrate! Sip on water or herbal tea.",
                    "Apply a cold compress to your forehead or neck."
                ]
            },
            {
                "name": "Tender Breasts",
                "symptom_text": "You may experience tender breasts",
                "fun_fact": "Boob fact! Breast tenderness can fluctuate throughout your cycle, thanks to those ever-changing hormones. You're not alone!",
                "possible_causes": [
                    "Hormonal changes during your cycle (hello, estrogen and progesterone!)",
                    "Wearing a poorly fitting bra (support is key!)",
                    "Caffeine intake (some studies suggest a link!)"
                ],
                "tips": [
                    "Consider reducing caffeine intake and see if it helps.",
                    "Try over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen or acetaminophen.",
                    "Wear a supportive bra, even during sleep if needed."
                ]
            },
            {
                "name": "Sticky",
                "symptom_text": "You may have Sticky Discharge",
                "fun_fact": "Did you know sticky discharge can actually help sperm travel to where it needs to go? It's all part of the amazing fertility dance!",
                "possible_causes": [
                    "Normal vaginal flora: A healthy vagina is a happy vagina, and some stickiness is totally normal.",
                    "Ovulation: Your body's gearing up for potential baby-making!",
                    "Hormonal fluctuations: Just your hormones doing their thing throughout your cycle."
                ],
                "tips": [
                    "Avoid douching: It can disrupt your natural pH balance and cause more issues.",
                    "Wear breathable cotton underwear: Let your lady parts breathe!",
                    "Stay hydrated: Water helps keep everything balanced down there."
                ]
            }
        ]
    },
    "message": "Menstruation calendar details retrieved successfully"
}

response.name: Get article content
response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "d39132ae-4216-4a23-8e6b-065afe088761",
        "title": "Your Journey to Pregnancy: A Guide",
        "overview": "Embark on your pregnancy journey with confidence and knowledge. This guide provides expert advice and actionable tips to support you every step of the way.",
        "module": "period_tracking",
        "template_id": null,
        "content": [
            "Conceiving a child is a deeply personal and often challenging journey.  Whether you're just starting to think about pregnancy or have been trying for a while, understanding your body and its cycles is key.  This guide offers a supportive framework to navigate this exciting time.",
            "First, track your menstrual cycle.  Understanding your cycle phases - follicular, ovulation, and luteal - is crucial.  Ovulation, typically occurring around days 12-16 of a 28-day cycle (though this varies), is when you're most fertile.  Using ovulation predictor kits or charting your basal body temperature can help pinpoint your most fertile days.  Maintaining a healthy lifestyle is also vital.  Eat a balanced diet rich in nutrients, exercise regularly, and manage stress through techniques like yoga or meditation.  Adequate sleep is also essential for both physical and mental well-being.",
            "Regular check-ups with your doctor are paramount.  They can assess your overall health, address any concerns, and provide personalized guidance.  Open communication with your partner is equally important; shared understanding and support are crucial during this journey.  Remember, conceiving may take time for some couples.  Be patient with yourself and celebrate the small victories along the way.  If you've been trying for over a year without success, seeking professional medical advice is recommended.",
            "Above all, nurture your emotional well-being.  This journey can be filled with both excitement and anxiety.  Practice self-care, connect with supportive friends and family, and don't hesitate to seek professional counseling if needed.  Your journey to pregnancy is unique, and your strength and resilience will guide you."
        ],

                            "article_id": "a6f5379f-a7a8-42a2-a978-6f50ede2af88",
                            "title": "Understanding Vaginal Discharge During Pregnancy",
                            "overview": "Experiencing changes in your body during pregnancy is completely normal, and vaginal discharge is often one of them. While it can be a little unnerving, most changes in discharge are perfectly harmless. This article will guide you through what's normal, what's not, and when you should contact your healthcare provider. We'll help you navigate this common pregnancy symptom with confidence.",

                        },
                        {
                            "article_id": "0f162ccd-05f7-4f46-8ccc-55442791550b",
                            "title": "Rainbow Babies: Hope After Loss",
                            "overview": "Navigating pregnancy after experiencing loss can be emotionally complex. This article explores the unique journey of carrying a 'rainbow baby' and offers guidance for managing your emotions and embracing hope.",
                            "thumbnail_url": "https://fastly.picsum.photos/id/152/200/200.jpg?hmac=jxm74qVoEmDIDdKJ1_I2QT6AhtYcq-KN75l_iotKiOw"

                        {

                            "title": "Implantation vs. Miscarriage: Knowing the Difference",
                            "overview": "Early pregnancy can be a whirlwind of emotions, filled with excitement and, understandably, some anxiety. Two key events that can cause confusion and concern are implantation and miscarriage. Understanding the differences between these two processes is crucial for your peace of mind. This article will help you distinguish between the signs and symptoms, empowering you to navigate this early stage with knowledge and confidence.",

This article aims to help you understand what stretch marks are, why they appear, and most importantly, how to embrace them as a symbol of your strength and the miracle of motherhood.",

This week is a bit of a technicality, as it's calculated from the first day of your last menstrual period (LMP). So, technically, you're not *actually* pregnant yet! Let's explore what's going on in your body during this pre-pregnancy phase.",

This week marks the beginning of significant hormonal changes and the start of your baby's development. Let's explore what's happening with you and your little one, and what you can do to support a healthy pregnancy.",

                            "overview": "Nourishing your body during pregnancy is one of the most important things you can do for yourself and your growing baby. This guide breaks down the essential nutrients, foods to embrace, and those to avoid, ensuring a healthy and happy nine months.",
                            "thumbnail_url": "https://fastly.picsum.photos/id/152/200/200.jpg?hmac=jxm74qVoEmDIDdKJ1_I2QT6AhtYcq-KN75l_iotKiOw"

                            "overview": "Congratulations on your pregnancy! This is an exciting, transformative time, but it can also be filled with questions. From morning sickness remedies to understanding fetal development, we've compiled answers to 130 of the most common pregnancy questions to help you navigate this incredible journey with confidence and peace of mind.",

While you're basking in the joy of motherhood, it's important to understand what happens next - specifically, the birth of the placenta. This article will guide you through the process, explaining the different methods and what to expect.",
